column5: i keep a machete in my truck all the time as well. comes in handy from time to time. used it to cut fire wood, and used it to chop up ice to get a stuck car out. lol
What's yours? Here's mine..   Kershaw Echo
Don't have a "camp knife" but I never leave home without my Swiss Army Knife  Maureen

This picture was taken in 1958 Danbo, it's my dad, my brother eddyk on your left and that's me on your right in the brown striped sweater.  You can see the bone handle of a knife on my right hip, and I've still got it and it still travels with me on all my camping trips.  Not bad for 50 years eh ??
Awesome Lew!

Gotta be the Benchmade Outbounder.  Holds a great edge and fits my hand well.  http://www.benchmade.com/products/product_....aspx?model=180  I had a Kydex sheath made for it as the leather one was a bit cumbersome.  Burt

For just around the camp I like to use my Gerber... looks like the pic but mines silver...  but for walking around the woods I like to use the big knife my surrogate dad gave me before he died when I was 16.  That one's got to be 7 inches long.. black handle... old and not very stylish but it's still sharp and solid.
I may have a bigger one somewhere with me but this is all I carry in the boat.  Done it for 15+ years with no problems.

Hey Lew,  Are you sure that is you in the photo?????  It appears to me that there is SMILE on your face.  Good on ya for keeping the old photos around.  I carry a swiss in my pocket and a good Gerber Multi-tool in my tackle box.  Brian
Love my Gerbers so much, I actually have two.

LEW, is that a smile??? You mean when you were a kid, you smiled, I find that hard to believe!!! LOL  I have a Gerber Multi Tool that I bought 15 years ago that goes wherever I do and for camping etc.... I have a CUTCO hunting knife that I bought 20 years ago that is fantastic. Also, my CUTCO Fisherman's Solution fishing knife accompanies me whenever I wet a line, it too is 20 years old and is very good.
Full Size Knife - Ka-Bar USMC 8" serrated   Multi Tool - Gerber Multi-Plier 800 Legend   Folding Knife - Buck Hunter 110
Keep 'em comin' !
Mine is a USA made Shrade  Joey
Hey, I've got one of those too ha ha ha sitting right in front of me on my deks....Doug might recongnize it though  Cheers, Ice Fisherman
Went and got mine out to see the make and now I am bleeding-Solinger bone handled 9 inch-got in 1962.Looks like a smaller version of crockodile dundee's!!  vance

OUCH!!  I did the same thing at LeB's, embarrassing.  Some evil closer mechanism bit me and left a mark.  Even worse, the dude behind the counter had a box of band aids.  Emil, nice job on the family, and thanks for looking after my knife for the past coupla years.  I can trade it for a box o pampers.

Got this a couple of years ago never leave home without it   http://www.lightfootknives.com/knives/suppressor.htm  my boat and bush knife is  http://www.benchmade.com/products/product_....aspx?model=610  and the one I want is http://www.lightfootknives.com/knives/night_strike.htm  I know I have issues
Holy Holster/Sheath Batman
PRETTY AINT IT!!!!!!!!!
i dont have a specific knife i use for camp, but my favorite knife would be my Marine Bowies i picked up in Colombia, TN...
I have this Gerber multi-tool on my belt every weekend....  http://www.gerbergear.com/product.php?model=7500G

i have a small collection of knives. i like knives and try to add to my collection whenever possible.  these are my 2 favorite, i use the first one here for most of my outtings that will be just day long or less.  U.S. Marine combat knife. very durable and strong blade.    this one i take camping and when i will be out for longer trips. full survival pack included inside handle, compass on butt of handle. blade is 10 1/2 inches long.
Good stuff!
I have and really like this one: http://www.knivesplus.com/QN-SP8-Ontario.HTML
